The Supplier and Zebracorp desire that the Supplier provides certain software products and services to Zebracorp and its customers, including Software as a Service (“SaaS”), as further described in and pursuant to the Software as a Service Appendix to this Agreement.
`Agreement` shall mean this Software License Agreement for Applications including all Appendices and any other document specifically incorporated herein by reference.
All Appendices shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
`Clause` shall mean any numbered paragraph or section of this Agreement.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including prices, are the Confidential Information of both Parties.

`Licensed Product` shall mean any and all software products including any software applications and components delivered under this Agreement including also the related Documentation as may be described in further detail in the Product Appendix and/or any Statement of Work, including any future modifications, Updates, Upgrades, bug fixes and Error corrections to any of the foregoing items.

`Licensed Product` shall mean any and all software products including any software applications and components delivered under this Agreement including also the related Documentation as may be described in further detail in the Product Appendix and/or any Statement of Work, including any future modifications, Updates, Upgrades, bug fixes and Error corrections to any of the foregoing items.

`Licensed Product` shall mean any and all software products including any software applications and components delivered under this Agreement including also the related Documentation as may be described in further detail in the Product Appendix and/or any Statement of Work, including any future modifications, Updates, Upgrades, bug fixes and Error corrections to any of the foregoing items.

`Legislative Requirements` shall mean i) all laws, regulations, acts, orders, by-laws, decrees, or other such ordinances of the jurisdiction where any Licensed Products are being manufactured, transported and delivered to and where any Services under this Agreement are being carried out, and ii) all requirements, permits, approvals, licences, certificates and other directives made by any other authorities, public bodies, or other organizations having jurisdiction in connection with the performance of this Agreement.
`Maintenance Services` shall mean the services described in Appendix `Maintenance and Support Agreement` of this Agreement.
`Maintenance Services` shall mean the services described in Appendix `Maintenance and Support Agreement` of this Agreement.

`Order` shall mean a document (i) which bears the title or identification `purchase order` or `order` on its face, (ii) issued by Zebracorp in an electronic format using Zebracorp’s internal order system tools, (iii) which contains the unique purchase order number, and (iv) in which Zebracorp requests Supplier to provide specific Licensed Product(s) and/or Services under the terms and conditions of this Agreement and such Licensed Products and Services are itemized with corresponding price, ordered quantity and item identification (either by line item code or by item description). Order may include, as applicable, also payment milestones, specifications, acceptance criteria, time schedule and delivery arrangements.

`Professional Services` shall mean any professional services (including without limitation consulting and integration services), and/or any other such services provided by Supplier pursuant to this Agreement as may be specified in further detail in the Statement of Work or a professional services agreement.

`Professional Services` shall mean any professional services (including without limitation consulting and integration services), and/or any other such services provided by Supplier pursuant to this Agreement as may be specified in further detail in the Statement of Work or a professional services agreement.
`Quality Requirements` shall mean the requirements that Zebracorp has defined in Clause XX (Quality to which all Products and Services shall strictly conform.

`Results of Services` shall mean all of the output and/or results of any Professional Services, including but not limited to technical documents, tooling, data, software (in both Source Code and Object Code) and/or any and all materials or documentation in whatever form arising out of or relating to the Professional Services, which are written, developed, generated or otherwise provided by the Supplier or by both Parties jointly pursuant to this Agreement (including the Statement of Work).

`Results of Services` shall mean all of the output and/or results of any Professional Services, including but not limited to technical documents, tooling, data, software (in both Source Code and Object Code) and/or any and all materials or documentation in whatever form arising out of or relating to the Professional Services, which are written, developed, generated or otherwise provided by the Supplier or by both Parties jointly pursuant to this Agreement (including the Statement of Work).

`Specifications` shall mean any data and information related to the design, function, performance, reliability and quality of the Licensed Products as set forth in this Agreement and any modifications or amendments and new specifications thereto.
`SOW` or `Statement of Work` shall mean a Customer Project specific document as further described in Clause 3 of this Agreement.
`SOW` or `Statement of Work` shall mean a Customer Project specific document as further described in Clause 3 of this Agreement.
Other capitalized terms used in this Agreement or any of its Appendices shall have the meanings as defined in the respective clauses of this Agreement or any the Appendices.
Other capitalized terms used in this Agreement or any of its Appendices shall have the meanings as defined in the respective clauses of this Agreement or any the Appendices.
Other capitalized terms used in this Agreement or any of its Appendices shall have the meanings as defined in the respective clauses of this Agreement or any the Appendices.
Other capitalized terms used in this Agreement or any of its Appendices shall have the meanings as defined in the respective clauses of this Agreement or any the Appendices.

2.1 The purpose of this Agreement is to set out the terms and conditions under which Zebracorp may order Licensed Products, the SaaS and Services from the Supplier and under which the Supplier agrees to provide the same to Zebracorp.
2.2 The Affiliates of Zebracorp may order Licensed Products, the SaaS and/or Services and agree SOWs in their own name and for their own account under the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

2.3 For the avoidance of doubt, it is expressly stated that nothing contained in this Agreement or otherwise shall mean that Zebracorp has any obligation to agree SOWs, place any Orders, or to have any other purchase commitments for any Licensed Products, the SaaS or Services under or in relation to this Agreement.
Upon Zebracorp’s request the Parties shall agree upon a Statement of Work, a template of which has been attached to this Agreement as Appendix “Statement of Work (SoW)”.
All Statements of Work shall reference this Agreement and shall form an integral part of this Agreement.
All Statements of Work shall reference this Agreement and shall form an integral part of this Agreement.
Subject to the execution of the Statement of Work both Parties agree to perform their respective obligations in accordance with the Statement of Work (and this Agreement).
Subject to the execution of the Statement of Work both Parties agree to perform their respective obligations in accordance with the Statement of Work (and this Agreement).
Zebracorp may request a change in the terms of the Statement of Work.
The Parties undertake to negotiate and agree the effects of such change to scope and contents of the Statement of Work.

The Supplier agrees to implement and execute any reasonable requested changes for a reasonable price substantially in accordance with the pricing principles and levels agreed in the Statement of Work and this Agreement.

input_refs.source_header: 5.	DELIVERY OF LICENSED PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES
input_refs.source_verbatim: Supplier shall deliver the Licensed Products in a timely manner and perform the Professional Services to the highest standard of skill, care, quality and diligence of a professional and in a timely and cost effective manner in accordance with and in full compliance with this Agreement, the respective Statement of Work and the Legislative Requirements.

input_refs.source_header: 5.	DELIVERY OF LICENSED PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES
input_refs.source_verbatim: In case this delivery method is not available and unless otherwise agreed, the Supplier shall deliver any Licensed Products in tangible media according to DDP VAT unpaid (INCOTERMS© 2020) to a place designated by Zebracorp within 5 (five) days from the date of the Order unless a later delivery date has been defined in the Order.

input_refs.source_header: 5.	DELIVERY OF LICENSED PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES
input_refs.source_verbatim: In the event that the Supplier fails to meet the agreed time schedule and/or any other milestones or such other fixed dates set forth in the SOW, then the Supplier shall be liable to pay Zebracorp liquidated damages in the amount of 0.5% per calendar day, capped at 10% of the affected Order value, and only applicable if the delay is not caused by force majeure or Zebracorp’s own actions..

Zebracorp may place Orders for the Licensed Products and Services by e-mail, by fax or in electronic form or in any other mutually agreed manner.
The Supplier may reject an Order within three (3) business days from the receipt of the Order, otherwise the Order shall be deemed accepted.
Supplier may however reject any Order only to the extent the Order is not in conformance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
Any Order rejection has to specify in detail the non-conformance of the Order in order to be valid.

In case Zebracorp’s Order, the Supplier's confirmation of an Order or the Supplier's invoice contain terms and conditions, which are in conflict with this Agreement, such terms and conditions shall be regarded as null and void.

Supplier shall provide to Zebracorp, in electronic format designed by Zebracorp, a list of Open Source Software contained in the Products provided under this Agreement.
Such list shall contain, with respect to each Open Source Software and any dependent components contained as parts of such Open Source Software the following information:
the component names of each Open Source Software,
the version of each Open Source Software component,

Supplier shall have a supplier base strategy and supplier base management for its sub-suppliers under this Agreement, based on short- and long-term business needs.
Supplier shall manage its sub-suppliers according to a documented procedure and the requirements under this Agreement.

Zebracorp, its Customers and their respective Contractors shall have the right, at its cost, following reasonable notice to Supplier and during normal business hours, to audit (at Supplier’s and/or Supplier sub-suppliers’ premises) and inspect the deliverables, facilities and quality control as well as other processes of Supplier in the performance of this Agreement, in order to determine the level of Supplier’s compliance with the Zebracorp specs and other standard industry practices and standards, where applicable, such as ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 (“Audit”).
The Supplier warrants that it shall at all times strictly comply with the IT-security related requirements set out in Appendix “Security Requirements”.

For the avoidance of doubt, compliance with this sub-section includes, but is not limited to, compliance with the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and any other applicable legislation enacted to enforce or implement any international convention prohibiting bribery and corruption and anti-money laundering laws and regulations.

Additionally, Supplier acknowledges that it has read and understands the Responsible Business Alliance Code of Conduct as updated from time to time (“RBA Code of Conduct”) (available at http://www.responsiblebusiness.org/standards/code-ofconduct/) and undertakes to apply the standards set out in the RBA Code of Conduct as well as the Zebracorp 3rd Party Code of Conduct with respect to the performance of this Agreement.

Supplier agrees to keep accurate and complete records relating to the provision of Products and Services under this Agreement, including records relating to obtaining any government issued permits or authorizations and related correspondence, and to retain all such records for 10 (ten) years following the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement or for any legally required record retention period, whichever is longer.

Supplier agrees to keep accurate and complete records relating to the provision of Products and Services under this Agreement, including records relating to obtaining any government issued permits or authorizations and related correspondence, and to retain all such records for 10 (ten) years following the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement or for any legally required record retention period, whichever is longer.

Supplier also agrees to report any non-routine contact by a government regulatory or law enforcement agency investigating or questioning Supplier’s conduct relating to the performance of this Agreement.

Failure by the Supplier to comply with the provisions of this Clause 15 shall be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement by Supplier entitling Zebracorp to terminate this Agreement without any liability to Zebracorp.

Failure by the Supplier to comply with the provisions of this Clause 15 shall be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement by Supplier entitling Zebracorp to terminate this Agreement without any liability to Zebracorp.

Failure by the Supplier to comply with the provisions of this Clause 15 shall be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement by Supplier entitling Zebracorp to terminate this Agreement without any liability to Zebracorp.
Supplier shall fully cooperate in any Zebracorp investigation or audit regarding its compliance with this Clause 15.

Supplier shall indemnify and hold Zebracorp, Zebracorp Affiliates, Customers, employees, officers, directors, shareholders, subcontractors or other representatives harmless from and against any claims, losses, damages, liabilities and costs arising out of, related to, or connected with Supplier’s or Supplier’s subcontractors’ failure to comply with any of the obligations set forth in this Agreement.

In addition to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “US Specific Provisions” shall apply to any purchases made by Zebracorp Affiliates located in the United States of America or, as applicable, to the extent any purchases made under this Agreement are made for the benefit of Zebracorp’s US based customers.

In addition to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “US Specific Provisions” shall apply to any purchases made by Zebracorp Affiliates located in the United States of America or, as applicable, to the extent any purchases made under this Agreement are made for the benefit of Zebracorp’s US based customers.

In addition to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “US Specific Provisions” shall apply to any purchases made by Zebracorp Affiliates located in the United States of America or, as applicable, to the extent any purchases made under this Agreement are made for the benefit of Zebracorp’s US based customers.
The Supplier shall provide Maintenance Services as set forth in this Clause and Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement (MSA)”.

The Supplier warrants that ´the Maintenance Services, including but not limited to Error correction of Licensed Products and software support in general shall be available to Zebracorp (and its Affiliates) subject to and in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement” for a period of ten (10) consecutive years from the last delivery of a Licensed Product under this Agreement

The Supplier warrants that ´the Maintenance Services, including but not limited to Error correction of Licensed Products and software support in general shall be available to Zebracorp (and its Affiliates) subject to and in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement” for a period of ten (10) consecutive years from the last delivery of a Licensed Product under this Agreement

Each Party ("Receiving Party") shall not disclose to third parties nor use for any purpose other than for the proper fulfilment of this Agreement any technical or commercial information ("Information") received from the other Party ("Disclosing Party") in whatever form under or in connection with this Agreement without the prior written permission of the Disclosing Party except information which:

Each Party ("Receiving Party") shall not disclose to third parties nor use for any purpose other than for the proper fulfilment of this Agreement any technical or commercial information ("Information") received from the other Party ("Disclosing Party") in whatever form under or in connection with this Agreement without the prior written permission of the Disclosing Party except information which:

Any disclosure of Information to any third party under Clause 17.1 above shall further be subject to that third party having a need to know such Information for the Purpose and subject to that third party being prior to the disclosure of Information bound by written confidentiality undertakings no less stringent than the obligations imposed under this Agreement.

Any disclosure of Information to any third party under Clause 17.1 above shall further be subject to that third party having a need to know such Information for the Purpose and subject to that third party being prior to the disclosure of Information bound by written confidentiality undertakings no less stringent than the obligations imposed under this Agreement.

The Supplier shall not make any statements, announcements and/or press release of this Agreement or part thereof, or of the relationship of the Parties, without the express prior written consent of Zebracorp.

Any Non-Disclosure Agreement(s) entered into between the Parties prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement shall remain to be valid, in accordance with its terms and conditions, in respect of the Information disclosed by either Party before the Effective Date of this Agreement, and in respect of the Information disclosed outside the scope of this Agreement.

Any Non-Disclosure Agreement(s) entered into between the Parties prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement shall remain to be valid, in accordance with its terms and conditions, in respect of the Information disclosed by either Party before the Effective Date of this Agreement, and in respect of the Information disclosed outside the scope of this Agreement.

Any Non-Disclosure Agreement(s) entered into between the Parties prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement shall remain to be valid, in accordance with its terms and conditions, in respect of the Information disclosed by either Party before the Effective Date of this Agreement, and in respect of the Information disclosed outside the scope of this Agreement.
This Agreement, the Statements of Work and/or any Orders may by written notice of a Party to the other Party be terminated for cause if and when the other Party:

it is expressly stated that any termination or expiration of this Agreement (or any Statement of Work) shall not affect any rights of the Customers granted to them in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement during the validity hereof.

input_refs.source_header: 20.	FORCE MAJEURE AND DUTY TO INFORM
input_refs.source_verbatim: Neither Party shall be held responsible for the non-performance of any obligations and duties under this Agreement, and/or any Order to the extent that such non-performance results from a Force Majeure event.

input_refs.source_header: 20.	FORCE MAJEURE AND DUTY TO INFORM
input_refs.source_verbatim: If the Force Majeure continues for a cumulative period of sixty (60) days or more, Zebracorp may terminate this Agreement and/or any Order which are not yet fully performed with immediate effect by giving Supplier written notice.

input_refs.source_header: 20.	FORCE MAJEURE AND DUTY TO INFORM
input_refs.source_verbatim: Supplier agrees to promptly inform Zebracorp in writing of event(s) that are about to occur or appear imminent and may reasonably affect Supplier's ability to meet any of its obligations under this Agreement and/or under an Order, including without limitation, a potential delay in Delivery, a material change in ownership of Supplier, infringement of third party Intellectual Property Rights, or any other action, omission or development which would be important for Zebracorp to be aware of in order to take precautions to prevent such from causing adverse effect to Zebracorp’s business, reputation, production schedule, or product liability.
With the exception of claims relating to Intellectual Property Rights indemnification under Clause 12
product liability under Clause 13
breach of confidentiality under Clause 17
Supplier shall procure and maintain the insurance coverage specified in the Insurance Requirements Appendix.

Where, under this Agreement, Supplier provides Services to Zebracorp or Customers, and Supplier’s access to personal data, in providing these Services, cannot be definitely excluded or is within the scope of the Agreement, the Parties shall execute and attach a Data Protection Appendix (“DPA”) to this Agreement, and Supplier shall process such personal data solely in accordance with the DPA, this Agreement and Zebracorp’s instructions.

the Parties shall execute and attach a Data Protection Appendix (“DPA”) to this Agreement, and Supplier shall process such personal data solely in accordance with the DPA, this Agreement and Zebracorp’s instructions.

Notwithstanding the aforementioned, if, during the Term of this Agreement, Supplier or Zebracorp become aware that such access to personal data can no longer be definitely excluded, the Parties shall discuss such requirements and amend the Agreement by executing and attaching a DPA without undue delay.

This Agreement (including its Appendices) state the entire agreement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersede all prior communications, whether written or oral, between the Parties.

However, the Parties acknowledge that some of the Appendices of this Agreement further include appendices that are intended to be revised periodically by Zebracorp (such as but not limited to Zebracorp specs) and to the extent that such revisions do not conflict with the terms and conditions of the Agreement or the respective Appendix, updated versions of such appendices may be issued by Zebracorp without requiring a formal amendment either to this Agreement or to the respective Appendix.

to the extent that such revisions do not conflict with the terms and conditions of the Agreement or the respective Appendix, updated versions of such appendices may be issued by Zebracorp without requiring a formal amendment either to this Agreement or to the respective Appendix.
updated versions of such appendices may be issued by Zebracorp without requiring a formal amendment either to this Agreement or to the respective Appendix.
The Agreement and the Appendices form one integral agreement.

In the event of any conflict between any terms and conditions of this Agreement and its Appendices, the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall prevail over those of any Appendix hereto unless otherwise explicitly stated in the Appendix whereby the respective Appendix shall prevail with respect to the subject matter stipulated therein.

the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall prevail over those of any Appendix hereto unless otherwise explicitly stated in the Appendix whereby the respective Appendix shall prevail with respect to the subject matter stipulated therein.
unless otherwise explicitly stated in the Appendix whereby the respective Appendix shall prevail with respect to the subject matter stipulated therein.
whereby the respective Appendix shall prevail with respect to the subject matter stipulated therein.

The Maintenance and Support Agreement Appendix shall at all times survive the termination or expiration or expiry of this Agreement.
The product roadmaps as described in the Agreement for the products under this appendix are attached hereto in Exhibit 3, if applicable.
The product roadmaps as described in the Agreement for the products under this appendix are attached hereto in Exhibit 3, if applicable.
This appendix is attached to and forms a part of the Agreement (contract number: […]) (the “Agreement”).
Unless otherwise noted or evident from the context, the capitalized terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Agreement.
Annex SWSU Software Services (Software Maintenance, Security Alert, Update & Upgrade Service)
Annex TrE Training/Enabling
Annex PPT Pricing and Payment Terms
Annex PoC Points of Contact
The Annexes to this MSA shall form integral parts of this MSA.

This MSA and its Annexes shall take precedence over the terms and conditions of the Agreement with regard to the subject matter described herein to the extent there is a conflict between the Agreement and this MSA.

In case there is a conflict between the Annexes and this MSA, the Annexes will prevail with regard to the subject matter described thereof to the extent there is a conflict between the MSA and the Annex.
As used in this MSA, the capitalized terms set forth in this section 1 shall have the meanings set forth below.
“On Site Service” shall mean services provided by Supplier upon Zebracorp’s request according to Annex OSS.

“Response Time” shall mean the time between Zebracorp’s notification in accordance with the mutual agreed interface description of an Error/Technical Query to the Supplier and the receipt of Supplier’s Initial Response, Workaround or Final Solution as defined in the Annex SWSU, as applicable.
“Service(s)” shall mean all those service(s) to be provided by Supplier under this MSA as more specifically defined in the Annexes hereto.
Further terms may be defined in the Annexes hereto or the Agreement.

During the term of this MSA, Supplier shall provide to Zebracorp Services agreed herein based on a Service-Order or as part of Supplier’s warranty obligations for Products as stipulated in Clause xx of the Agreement.
Upon receipt of a Service-Order, the Supplier shall supply Services in accordance with the terms and conditions of this MSA and its Annexes.

The Supplier shall notify Zebracorp in writing and reasonably (not less than 3 months) in advance about any relevant Service-Order which is subject to annual renewal in accordance with Annex PPT (Pricing and Payment Terms).
The prices for the Services under this MSA are stated in Annex PPT hereto
or in the Product Appendix of the Agreement.
In the event the prices for the Services are stated in the Product Appendix
and not in the Annex PPT
unless otherwise stated in Annex PPT hereto.
Invoices shall be sent to the address stated in the Service-Order.
as defined in Annex PoC to this MSA.
Notwithstanding the regulations in Clause xx of the Agreement
the respective stipulations in Annexes SWSU shall apply for delay in the provision of Services.
or in the respective Annex(es) hereto
With respect to warranty period for Software Services stipulated in Annex SWSU

Without prejudice to Supplier’s obligation to strictly comply with the security requirements set forth in the Product Security Requirements Appendix, Supplier shall make the Software easy to maintain.
Zebracorp can request Supplier to develop the customization feature under a statement of work based on the fee structure as specified in Annex PPT, Service Price List.
The contact names and phone numbers of the Supplier’s management are defined in the Annex POC.
The regulations of Quality Assurance Appendix to the Agreement shall apply to Supplier’s performance of Services.
The Annexes to this MSA contain written workflow descriptions which may be supplemented by diagrams/illustrations to describe such workflows.
